1808                ax.add_collection(Line3DCollection(np.array([x_xi, y_xi, z_xi]).transpose(1, 2, 0), colors=elem_color, zorder=1)) # type: ignore
1809                ax.add_collection(Line3DCollection(np.array([x_eta, y_eta, z_eta]).transpose(2, 1, 0), colors=elem_color, zorder=1)) # type: ignore
1810                # ax.plot_surface(x, y, z, rcount=1, ccount=1, edgecolor=border_color, facecolor=None, alpha=0)
1811                ctrl_handle = lines.Line2D([], [], color=ctrl_color, marker='o', linestyle='-', label=ctrl_mesh)
1812                elem_handle = lines.Line2D([], [], color=elem_color, linestyle='-', label=elems_bord)
1813                border_handle = lines.Line2D([], [], color=border_color, linestyle='-', label=patch_bord)
1814                ax.legend(handles=[ctrl_handle, elem_handle, border_handle])
1815                mid_param = [np.array([sum(self.bases[0].span)/2]), np.array([sum(self.bases[1].span)/2])]
1816                dxi, deta = self.__call__(ctrl_pts, mid_param, k=1)
1817                nx, ny, nz = np.cross(dxi.ravel(), deta.ravel())
1818                azim = np.degrees(np.arctan2(ny, nx))
1819                elev = np.degrees(np.arcsin(nz / np.sqrt(nx**2 + ny**2 + nz**2)))
1820                ax.view_init(elev=elev + 30, azim=azim)
1821            elif self.NPa==3:
1822                XI = self.linspace(n_eval_per_elem=n_eval_per_elem)
1823                XI_elem = self.linspace(n_eval_per_elem=1)
1824                for face in range(3):
1825                    for side in [-1, 0]:
1826                        XI_face = list(XI)
1827                        XI_face[face] = np.array([XI[face][side]])
1828                        X = np.squeeze(np.array(self.__call__(ctrl_pts, XI_face)))
1829                        ax.plot_surface(*X, rcount=1, ccount=1, edgecolor=None, color=interior_color, alpha=0.5)
1830                for axis in range(3):
1831                    ctrl_mesh_axis = np.rollaxis(ctrl_pts, axis + 1, 1).reshape((3, ctrl_pts.shape[axis + 1], -1))
1832                    ax.add_collection(Line3DCollection(ctrl_mesh_axis.transpose(2, 1, 0), colors=ctrl_color, zorder=2)) # type: ignore
1833                ax.scatter(*ctrl_pts.reshape((3, -1)), color=ctrl_color, zorder=2)
1834                for face in range(3):
1835                    for side in [-1, 0]:
1836                        for face_i, transpose in zip(sorted([(face + 1)%3, (face + 2)%3]), ((1, 2, 0), (2, 1, 0))):
1837                            XI_elem_border = list(XI)
1838                            XI_elem_border[face] = np.array([XI[face][side]])
1839                            XI_elem_border[face_i] = XI_elem[face_i]
1840                            X_elem_border = np.squeeze(np.array(self.__call__(ctrl_pts, XI_elem_border)))
1841                            ax.add_collection(Line3DCollection(X_elem_border.transpose(*transpose), colors=elem_color, zorder=1)) # type: ignore
1842                ctrl_handle = lines.Line2D([], [], color=ctrl_color, marker='o', linestyle='-', label=ctrl_mesh)
1843                elem_handle = lines.Line2D([], [], color=elem_color, linestyle='-', label=elems_bord)
1844                border_handle = lines.Line2D([], [], color=border_color, linestyle='-', label=patch_bord)
1845                ax.legend(handles=[ctrl_handle, elem_handle, border_handle])
1846            else:
1847                raise ValueError(f"Can't plot a {self.NPa}D shape in a 3D space.")
1848        else:
1849            raise ValueError(f"Can't plot in a {NPh}D space.")

Plot the B-spline using Matplotlib.

Creates a visualization of the B-spline geometry showing the control mesh, B-spline surface/curve, element borders, and patch borders. Supports plotting 1D curves and 2D surfaces in 2D space, and 2D surfaces and 3D volumes in 3D space.

Parameters
  • ctrl_pts (np.ndarray[np.floating]): Control points defining the B-spline geometry. Shape: (NPh, n1, n2, ...) where:
    • NPh is the dimension of the physical space (2 or 3)
    • ni is the number of control points in the i-th isoparametric dimension
  • n_eval_per_elem (Union[int, Iterable[int]], optional): Number of evaluation points per element for visualizing the B-spline. Can be specified as:
    • Single integer: Same number for all dimensions
    • Iterable of integers: Different numbers for each dimension By default, 10.
  • ax (Union[mpl.axes.Axes, None], optional): Matplotlib axes for plotting. If None, creates a new figure and axes. For 3D visualizations, must be a 3D axes if provided (created with projection='3d'). Default is None (creates new axes).
  • ctrl_color (str, optional): Color for the control mesh visualization:
    • Applied to control points (markers)
    • Applied to control mesh lines Default is '#1b9e77' (green).
  • interior_color (str, optional): Color for the B-spline geometry:
    • For curves: Line color
    • For surfaces: Face color (with transparency)
    • For volumes: Face color of boundary surfaces (with transparency) Default is '#7570b3' (purple).
  • elem_color (str, optional): Color for element boundary visualization:
    • Shows internal mesh structure
    • Helps visualize knot locations Default is '#666666' (gray).
  • border_color (str, optional): Color for patch boundary visualization:
    • Outlines the entire B-spline patch
    • Helps distinguish patch edges Default is '#d95f02' (orange).
  • language (str, optional): Language for the plot labels. Can be 'english' or 'français'. Default is 'english'.
Notes

Visualization components:

  • Control mesh: Shows control points and their connections
  • B-spline: Shows the actual curve/surface/volume
  • Element borders: Shows the boundaries between elements
  • Patch borders: Shows the outer boundaries of the B-spline

Supported configurations:

  • 1D B-spline in 2D space (curve)
  • 2D B-spline in 2D space (surface)
  • 2D B-spline in 3D space (surface)
  • 3D B-spline in 3D space (volume)

For 3D visualization:

  • Surfaces are shown with transparency
  • Volume visualization shows the faces with transparency
  • View angle is automatically set for surfaces based on surface normal
Examples

Plot a 2D curve in 2D space:

>>> degrees = [2]
>>> knots = [np.array([0, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1], dtype='float')]
>>> spline = BSpline(degrees, knots)
>>> ctrl_pts = np.random.rand(2, 3)  # 2D control points
>>> spline.plotMPL(ctrl_pts)

Plot a 2D surface in 3D space:

>>> degrees = [2, 2]
>>> knots = [np.array([0, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1], dtype='float'),
...          np.array([0, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1], dtype='float')]
>>> spline = BSpline(degrees, knots)
>>> ctrl_pts = np.random.rand(3, 3, 3)  # 3D control points
>>> spline.plotMPL(ctrl_pts)

Plot on existing axes with custom colors:

>>> fig = plt.figure()
>>> ax = fig.add_subplot(projection='3d')
>>> spline.plotMPL(ctrl_pts, ax=ax, ctrl_color='red', interior_color='blue')
